title: Sets and Membership Checking
concept: This level works with set-like operations: unique elements, intersections, and membership tracking, implemented in C using arrays and loops. Problems are adapted from Snakify set tasks.

challenges.title: Distinct Numbers Count
challenges.description: Given N and a list of N integers, determine how many distinct numbers there are.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N followed by N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: number of distinct values.

challenges.title: Common Elements Count
challenges.description: Given two lists, count how many distinct numbers occur in both of them.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N and N integers, then integer M and M integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: count of distinct elements that appear in both lists.

challenges.title: Common Elements Sorted
challenges.description: Given two lists of numbers, find all numbers that occur in both lists and print them in ascending order without duplicates.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N and N integers, then integer M and M integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Common distinct elements in ascending order.

challenges.title: Seen Before?
challenges.description: Given a sequence of N integers, for each number print YES if this number has been seen earlier in the sequence, otherwise print NO.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N followed by N integers.
challenges.outputDescription: N lines: YES or NO for each element.
examples:
Input:
6
1 2 1 2 3 2

Output:
NO
NO
YES
YES
NO
YES

tests.expected:
NO
NO
YES
YES
NO
YES

challenges.title: Alice and Bob Cubes
challenges.description: Alice has N cubes and Bob has M cubes. Each cube is labeled with a number (color code). Find: (1) numbers present in both sets, (2) only in Alice's set, (3) only in Bob's set. For each set, print its size, then its elements in ascending order.
challenges.inputDescription: N, then N integers for Alice; M, then M integers for Bob.
challenges.outputDescription: Three lines: each line begins with count then the sorted elements.
examples: Example description only; exact input/output will depend on values.

challenges.title: Distinct Words in Text
challenges.description: Given n lines of text, print the number of distinct words that appear. A word is a sequence of non-space characters.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer n followed by n lines of text.
examples: Example: for lines 'hi hi' and 'world', distinct words are {hi, world} -> 2.

challenges.title: Numbers Only in First List
challenges.description: Given two lists of numbers, print distinct numbers that appear only in the first list and not in the second, in ascending order.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N and N integers, then integer M and M integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Numbers only in first list, sorted ascending.

challenges.title: Numbers Only in Second List
challenges.description: Given two lists of numbers, print distinct numbers that appear only in the second list and not in the first, in ascending order.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N and N integers, then integer M and M integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Numbers only in second list, sorted ascending.

challenges.title: Union of Two Lists
challenges.description: Given two lists of numbers, print all distinct numbers that appear in at least one of them, in ascending order.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer N and N integers, then integer M and M integers.
challenges.outputDescription: Distinct union elements in ascending order.

challenges.title: Words Seen Before?
challenges.description: Given one line of text, for each word print how many times it has appeared before it in the text. Words are separated by spaces.
challenges.outputDescription: For each word, an integer count printed on the same line separated by spaces.
examples:
Input:
one two one two two

Output:
0 0 1 1 2
